title: 2025 layoffs aren’t routine: AI rewires workflows; reskilling misses the point
description: The 2025 layoff wave reflects structural shifts, not mere cost-cutting. Companies, particularly in tech, are redirecting capital from headcount to AI infrastructure, automating tasks, and redesigning workflows. Pandemic-era hiring created surplus roles now being flattened. Reskilling alone won’t protect employees; differentiation comes from proving measurable impact. Students and professionals must focus on solving real problems, building domain-specific skill stacks, and demonstrating tangible improvements, as employers prioritise judgment and workflow integration over certificates or interchangeable skills.

Indians prefer Georgia over Ukraine for MBBS studies, RBI reports remittance increase
description: Indian students are increasingly choosing Georgia for MBBS studies, moving away from Ukraine due to the ongoing war. RBI data under the Liberalised Remittance Scheme (LRS) shows $50.25 million sent to Georgia in 2024-25, nearly five times the $10.33 million in 2018-19. Ukraine’s remittances fell sharply to $2.40 million. Russia remains an alternative with $69.94 million sent. Georgia’s low fees, English instruction, secure environment, and proximity to Europe have made it a rising destination for Indian medical students.

9,000 mysterious objects spotted off US shores; experts baffled
description: Tens of thousands of mysterious underwater objects, dubbed Unidentified Submersible Objects (USOs), have been logged near US coastlines by a UFO-tracking platform. These objects exhibit extreme speeds and uncanny maneuverability, even transitioning between water and air. Experts are divided, with some suggesting advanced technology or phenomena beyond current understanding, while others point to potential government deception regarding maritime security threats.

Powered by public participation and coordinated government efforts, this project aims to ensure lasting social and economic upliftment across Kerala.
